column4: i have an iso downloaded to my desktop... how do i get it onto cd?
is anything on your desktop?  Can you right click on your desktop?
and mMezquitale, no nothing happens when i right click on desktop, and well, i guess each thing i had on the desktop is actually a link to its location in the filesystem
don't know what to report, i typed nautilus in a terminal, and the nautilus filesys opened
well now see if the problem persists or if anything changed
voila, they're all back .. but WHY?
nautilus handles that stuff, it crashed for some reason
it would be nice to toggle that on and off, is there a way?
having all that mess i have on my desktop on and off
you can use toggle the gconf key that has nautilus show_desktop on and off (use gconftool-2 command)
you want to toggle the show_desktop key.  Of course, you want to learn to use gconftool-2 instead of the gconf-editor to do it
thx i will check out the page
